title: Am I racist for not liking rap? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you dislike it simply because you can’t connect with the lyrics, or you think the music itself is too harsh, or its too fast, or the synths want to make you sick, or it's too repetitive, that’s fine. If you don’t like it because simply because of the music, that is in no way shape or form racist. I am not the biggest fan of metal, some songs I like, however, many I don’t. If you dislike the culture surrounding rap, that is also fine. I dislike the imagery that surrounds the lyrics of most rap songs, getting girls, making money. I find it to be obscene and vulgar. However, when I find a rap song that doesn’t focus on these sorts of things, I like it more, because it has detached itself from the culture that has attached itself to rap. You’re allowed to have your opinions. No one can change them. If you dislike the music, simply for the music, that’s fine. Simply put, just avoid the music. And which race would you be racist against for disliking rap? In the 1980’s, when rap was first gaining momentum, it was seen as “black music”, just as in the same way Jazz had been in the 1930’s. This was because rap originated in African American culture. The main “race” of rap, was people of colour. However, this has changed. One of the best selling rap artists of all time, Eminem, has discussed this multiple times in his earlier songs, discussing how that people thought he shouldn’t rap because he was white. Dr Dre summed it up perfectly: “I don't give a f*ck if you're purple; if you can kick it, I'm working with you.” That was 16/17 years ago. Rap has changed massively in that time, it nearly doubled its lifespan as a genre since it was first accepted into the mainstream as a form of music in the 1980’s. It’s difficult to now pin down a certain race as being the main race of rap because there are now so many people from so many ethnic groups who rap. It is now much more culturally diverse and has developed its own culture. For not liking rap, are you being racist to all these different races? If you go out your way and say: “I hate rap. It's black music, and is below me”, yes that can be seen as both racist and offensive. But you just don’t like it because of how it sounds? Is that racist? The answer: No. Not at all.

I remember rap from the very first rap song—"Rappers Delight" by The Sugar Hill Gang. It was a groundbreaking, cultural phenomenon in 1979 (or thereabouts). It was a catchy, unique, and fun song, with lyrics that featured a mix of good-natured self aggrandizement, and entertaining storytelling. Rap continued to grow for the next decade, or so, adding themes of cultural awareness to the mix. At some point, someone whose name I cannot recall released a song about a loose girl entitled "Roxanne, Roxanne," followed closely by a similarly themed song named "Veronica, Veronica." Rap had officially entered its "whore phase." Copious amounts of songs that were denigrating to women soon flooded the genre. I had recently been turned on to Sting and The Police, at the time, so I consider myself fortunate that my consciousness had somewhere else to go. A few rap artists of substance arose, but while rap mostly pandered to the lowest common denominator—deteriorating into simple, repetitive, patterns and themes of violence, and drug use—my attention went full-time to rock and guitar music. Today, that which I hear of the hip hop genre is (for the most part) completely unintelligible… I'm not exaggerating. It sounds like pure audio garbage, scraped from the bottom of a barrel of ignorance. If dislike of that tripe constitutes racism, I'm ready for my first cross-burning.

Depends on why. Do you not like rap because of all the black people involved in it? Then yeah, that might be a racist reason for not liking rap. Do you not like rap because it's just musically not your cup of tea as you prefer Japanese shamisen music or EDM or bluegrass instead, but the race of the performers has nothing to do with it? Then your dislike of rap is likely not racial in nature.

Not if you dislike rap made by white rappers equally with rap made by black rappers, or Chinese rap, or any other form. If you dislike it all, then it's obviously the music and not the people making it that you have a problem with.

Probably lol if you have to ask this question haha. Are black people racist for liking country or white people racist for liking the blues. C'mon how authentic is this question. What's the real reason, if any, behind this question.

Not liking rap doesn’t make you racist. But it doesn’t make you non racist either. Do you treat people fairly without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, sexual preference? Those are the tell tale signs.
Do you actually dislike listening to rap music, or do you not like it because it’s made by black people? If you just don’t enjoy listening to the music, it’s not racist.
If you just dislike the music, then absolutely not. Creating music is an art just like painting. Not all people like the same paintings, and not everyone's going to enjoy the same music.

No, because rap is not performed only by one race, it is a multicultural genre. Just be mindful that people who stereotype rap may ironically accuse you of being “racist”, so be careful who you tell that to.
No. If you don't like black people, you are racist. I do have one recommendation for you: just listen to classic rap.
It's a musical style. It has no rights. It's like being racist for not liking cubism or impressionism.
What a stupid question, you like what you like and you don't like what you don't like. It's as simple as that
Rap is crap not even music more poetry
